goal.ch: 柏拉圖哲學乃即是古希臘經典哲學之始祖，也是西方哲學主要古典典範。若不理解其哲思，不但無法理解西方哲學之基源性生成，也不會體悟西方哲思主流之基調。然而因為其首創的對話錄原典文本著作等身，其哲學廣度包含以後西方系統哲學各學科，其哲思生成發展史縱深從早期經中期至晚期，各有千秋。本課程欲對其哲學除進行整體性導論與導讀外，也將首次開展其體系性哲思。因此需先呈現古希臘哲學之文化歷史脈絡及生成發展脈絡，尤其是系統式玄元哲思緣起，接著介紹柏拉圖生平及著作，然後探討其從早期，經中期，至晚期之哲思生成、發展及轉折，特別是主要著作中的形上學理論亦即理念論 之為idealism之首次體系性型態，及其運用向度如倫理學之義理脈絡，並精選主要文本進行導讀，尤其是其後期體系性哲思之兩重要著作之主要相關文本選讀與精讀，亦即《巴門尼德斯》（Parmenides）以及《辯士》(Sophistes)，然後各自揭示其中體系性思想以及其發展潛能，期使學子能進入西方哲思最古典之心靈與經典世界，也得以學習體系性思維！
goal.en: Plato‘s philosophy is not only the founder of classic Greek philosophy, but also the original classical paradigm of Western philosophy. Failure to understand his philosophizing, one does neither perceive the initial origin of Western philosophy, nor realize the fundamental tone of main stream of Western philosophizing. However, because his innovative style of original text in dialogues is so prolific, and his philosophical breadth encompasses various disciplines of Western systematic philosophy, and his genesis and progress of his philosophizing depth unfolds from the early phase through the middle phase to late phase, it is very difficult to comprehend Plato holistically and systemically. This course attempts not only to carry out a holistic introduction and reading of Plato’s philosophy, but also tries to find out his systemic thinking, therefore it shall begin with cultural-historical context and genesis-development of ancient Greek systematical arche-philosophy, introduce the life and writings of Plato, then explore his philosophical genesis, progress, transformation and integration from the early through the middle to the late stage, particularly his metaphysics i.e. the theory of ideas as the first systemic form of idealism and its applications in practical dimension especially in ethics in the major works, and guide to read the chosen classical texts, in particular, a selection and close reading of the main relevant texts of two important works of later systemic philosophy, namely Parmenides and Sophistes, and eventually introduce the students in the systemic way of thinking,  to enable them to enter into the world of the most classical spirit and classics of Western philosophizing!

outline.ch:
1.導論
2.世界文明史巨觀脈絡中古希臘文化史脈絡
3.古希臘哲學生成發展史I：前蘇時期玄元自然哲學
4.古希臘哲學生成發展史II：前蘇時期辯士語言哲學
5.古希臘哲學生成發展史III：蘇格拉底體系性思想之基源
6.柏拉圖哲學生平與著作總覽及其系統性
7.柏拉圖早期哲思階段及對話錄I: 蘇格拉底之幽靈
8.柏拉圖早期哲思階段及對話錄II: 走向原創理念論
9.柏拉圖早期哲思階段及對話錄III: 轉向--Protagoras導讀
10.柏拉圖中期哲思階段及對話錄I: 系統式或系統性理念論？
11.柏拉圖中期哲思階段及對話錄II : Politeia(【邦國】)導讀
12.柏拉圖轉向晚期哲思階段及對話錄I: 理念論批判以及體系性觀念論：Parmenides導讀1
13.柏拉圖轉向晚期哲思階段及對話錄II: 理念論批判以及體系性觀念論：Parmenides導讀2
14.柏拉圖晚期哲思階段及對話錄I: Sophistes (【辯士】)導讀1
15.柏拉圖晚期哲思階段及對話錄II: Sophistes (【辯士】)導讀2
16.柏拉圖體系性哲思開放性總結
17.自主學習
18.自主學習
outline.en:
1. Introduction
2. The cultural-historical context of the ancient Greek in the context of world civilization
3. The genesis and development of ancient Greek philosophy I: the pre-socratic period: Arche natural philosophy
4. The genesis and development of ancient Greek philosophy II: sophistic linguistic philosophy
5. The genesis and development of ancient Greek philosophy III:: Socrates philosophizing as origin of systemic thinking
6. Systematics of the life and writings of Plato: Philosophical overview
7. Plato‘s early stage of philosophizing and dialogue I: The Phantom of Socrates
8. Plato‘s early stage of philosophizing and dialogue II: Towards the original systemic theory of Ideas
9.  Plato‘s early stage of philosophizing and dialogue III: Reading the dialogue Protagoras
10. Plato‘s middle stage of philosophizing and dialogues I : Theory of ideas – systematic or systemic?
11. Plato‘s middle stage of philosophizing and dialogues II: Reading The Politeia (Republic)
12. Plato‘s Transition to Late Philosophy and Dialogue I: Critique of theory of ideas and die systemic idealism
: Reading Parmenides 1
13. Plato‘s Transition to Late Philosophy and Dialogue II: Critique of theory of ideas and die systemic idealism
: Reading Parmenides 2
14. Plato‘s late stage of philosophizing and dialogues I: Reading Sophistes 1
15. Plato‘s late stage of philosophizing and dialogues II: Reading Sophistes 2
16. Open Summary: Plato‘s Systemic Philosophizing Summary
